raw_comment:
I notice a graph that shows the percentages of how frequently young men and women reach out to their parents. In general, it is more likely for young men and women to reach out through texts with about 50% of young men and about 70% for women. Overall, women are more likely to contact their parents than men. 

I wonder how this may affect the future generations when reaching out to parents. If communications between children and their parents become less likely, is it more likely for crimes to increase? Most children depend on their parents for decision making, to educate them and lead them on the right path but if communications decrease significantly most children can begin to depend on themselves.

 Most children depend on their parents for decision making, to educate them and lead them on the right path but if communications decrease significantly most children can begin to depend on themselves and that can lead to complete chaos.

Young People Reaching Out: A Viewpoint on Generational Shifts in Parental Relationships

In general, young men are more likely to reach out through texts.

About 50% of young men reach out through texts.
About 70% of young women reach out through texts.
Overall, women are more likely to contact their parents than men.
I wonder how this may affect future generations.
I wonder how future generations will reach out to parents.
Communications between children and their parents may become less likely.
If communications between children and their parents become less likely then crimes may increase.

Most children depend on their parents for education.
Most children depend on their parents for guidance on the right path.

The headline is: Young People Reaching Out: A Viewpoint on Generational Shifts in Parental Relationships.
